screen_design_ref: Figure 11.1: Email Verification Pending Page Layout
description: Verify that the Email Verification Pending page loads correctly after successful user registration
scenario: User completes registration and is redirected to verification pending page with email sent confirmation
expected_results: Display the complete verification pending page with success message and email verification instructions
procedure:
1. Open web browser
2. Navigate to registration page and complete signup
3. Verify redirect to /auth/verification-pending with proper parameters
4. Check page title displays 'Email Verification Required'
5. Verify success message 'Account created successfully!' is shown
6. Check email address is displayed correctly
7. Verify verification instructions are visible

screen_design_ref: Figure 11.2: Verification Pending Page Header Design
description: Verify the verification pending header displays correctly with success styling
scenario: User views the verification pending header with cybersecurity-themed design
expected_results: Display 'Account Created Successfully!' or 'Email Verification Required' with envelope-check icon and proper styling
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Verify gradient background (bg-gray-50 dark:bg-gray-900)
3. Check envelope-check icon (bi-envelope-check) in green circle
4. Verify animated pulse effect on icon (animate-pulse-slow)
5. Check title changes based on context (registration vs login attempt)
6. Verify subtitle text displays appropriately
7. Test dark mode compatibility with header styling

description: Verify email address information is displayed correctly in verification pending page
scenario: User views the verification pending page and sees their email address prominently displayed
expected_results: Display user's email address in a styled container with envelope icon
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page with user_email parameter
2. Verify email display container with blue styling (bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-900/20)
3. Check envelope icon (bi-envelope) is present
4. Verify 'Verification email sent to:' label
5. Check user email is displayed in bold font
6. Test email display with various email formats
7. Verify email container styling in dark mode

description: Verify the step-by-step verification instructions display correctly
scenario: User views detailed instructions on how to complete email verification
expected_results: Display numbered steps with clear instructions for email verification process
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Verify 'Next Steps:' heading is displayed
3. Check step 1: 'Check your email inbox for a verification message'
4. Verify step 2: 'Click the verification link in the email'
5. Check step 3: 'Return to the login page and sign in'
6. Verify numbered circles with green styling
7. Test instruction visibility and readability

description: Verify important notes and warnings display correctly
scenario: User views important information about email verification requirements
expected_results: Display yellow-styled warning box with important verification information
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Verify yellow warning container (bg-yellow-50 dark:bg-yellow-900/20)
3. Check exclamation-triangle icon (bi-exclamation-triangle)
4. Verify 'Important:' heading
5. Check bullet point about checking spam folder
6. Verify '24 hours expiration' warning
7. Check 'cannot log in until verified' notice
8. Test warning styling in dark mode

description: Verify resend verification email functionality works correctly
scenario: User clicks resend verification email button and receives new verification email
expected_results: New verification email is sent and user receives confirmation message
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Verify 'Didn't receive the email?' text is displayed
3. Check resend form with CSRF token and hidden fields
4. Click 'Resend Verification Email' button
5. Verify form submission with proper CSRF validation
6. Check new verification email is sent
7. Verify success message after resend
8. Test button loading state during submission

description: Verify action buttons for navigation work correctly
scenario: User uses action buttons to navigate to login or home page
expected_results: Buttons provide proper navigation with appropriate styling and functionality
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Verify 'Go to Login' button with green gradient styling
3. Check box-arrow-in-right icon is present
4. Click 'Go to Login' and verify navigation to login page
5. Return to verification page
6. Verify 'Return Home' button with gray gradient styling
7. Check house icon is present
8. Click 'Return Home' and verify navigation to home page

description: Verify automatic verification status checking works correctly
scenario: Page automatically checks if user has verified email and redirects accordingly
expected_results: Page checks verification status every 30 seconds and redirects when verified
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Open browser developer tools Network tab
3. Wait and observe AJAX requests to check_verification_status endpoint
4. Verify requests are made every 30 seconds
5. In another tab, verify email address using verification link
6. Return to pending page and verify automatic redirect to login
7. Check success toast message is displayed
8. Test auto-refresh stops after 10 attempts (5 minutes)

description: Verify email verification token processing works correctly
scenario: User clicks verification link in email and token is processed successfully
expected_results: Valid token verifies email address and redirects to login with success message
procedure:
1. Register new user account
2. Check email for verification link
3. Click verification link from email
4. Verify navigation to /auth/verify-email/[token] endpoint
5. Check token validation and processing
6. Verify success message 'Email address verified successfully!'
7. Check redirect to login page
8. Verify email is marked as verified in database

description: Verify proper handling of invalid or malformed verification tokens
scenario: User attempts to access verification endpoint with invalid token
expected_results: Display error message and redirect to login page for invalid tokens
procedure:
1. Navigate to /auth/verify-email/invalid_token_123
2. Verify error message 'Invalid verification token.'
3. Check redirect to login page
4. Test with malformed token characters
5. Test with empty token parameter
6. Verify no sensitive information is exposed
7. Check error logging for debugging purposes
8. Test token that doesn't exist in database

description: Verify proper handling of expired verification tokens (24 hour limit)
scenario: User attempts to use verification token after 24 hour expiration period
expected_results: Display expiration error message and redirect to login page
procedure:
1. Generate verification token and simulate 24+ hour age
2. Navigate to verification URL with expired token
3. Verify error message 'Verification token has expired. Please request a new one.'
4. Check redirect to login page
5. Test token expiration at exact 24-hour mark
6. Verify token cleanup removes expired tokens
7. Check database query efficiency for expiration check
8. Test user guidance for requesting new verification

description: Verify proper handling when verification token has already been used
scenario: User clicks verification link that has already been used to verify email
expected_results: Display informational message and redirect to login page
procedure:
1. Complete email verification process successfully
2. Attempt to use same verification link again
3. Verify message 'Email address has already been verified. You can now log in.'
4. Check redirect to login page
5. Verify token remains marked as verified
6. Test user experience with clear messaging
7. Check no duplicate verification processing occurs
8. Verify database integrity with multiple verification attempts

description: Verify email service integration and HTML email template rendering
scenario: System sends verification email with proper HTML template and content
expected_results: Email is sent with cybersecurity-themed HTML template and proper verification link
procedure:
1. Register new user account
2. Check email is received in user's inbox
3. Verify email subject 'Verify Your Email Address - Phalanx Cyber Academy'
4. Check HTML email template with blue gradient header
5. Verify welcome message with username personalization
6. Check verification button with proper URL
7. Test fallback link in email
8. Verify 24-hour expiration notice in email
9. Check email displays correctly in various email clients

description: Verify proper error handling when email service fails
scenario: Email service is unavailable or misconfigured during verification email sending
expected_results: Graceful error handling with proper logging and user feedback
procedure:
1. Configure invalid email server settings
2. Attempt to register new user account
3. Verify user account is created despite email failure
4. Check appropriate warning message is displayed
5. Test with missing MAIL_SERVER configuration
6. Verify error is logged properly for debugging
7. Check resend functionality works when email service recovers
8. Test user experience with clear messaging about email issues

description: Verify CSRF token integration and protection for resend functionality
scenario: User submits resend verification form with CSRF protection enabled
expected_results: CSRF token is properly included and validated with form submission
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. View page source and verify csrf_token hidden field in resend form
3. Submit resend form with valid CSRF token
4. Verify CSRF token is included in POST request
5. Test form submission without CSRF token (should fail)
6. Check CSRF validation error handling
7. Verify security against CSRF attacks
8. Test CSRF token refresh on page reload

description: Verify proper handling when unverified user attempts to login
scenario: User with unverified email attempts to login and is redirected to verification page
expected_results: Display specific message about login being blocked until email verification
procedure:
1. Register user account but don't verify email
2. Attempt to login with unverified account
3. Verify redirect to verification pending page with login_attempt=true
4. Check special info box about 'Login Temporarily Blocked'
5. Verify warning message about email verification requirement
6. Check blue info styling (bg-blue-50 dark:bg-blue-900/20)
7. Test user experience with clear guidance
8. Verify login is properly blocked until verification

description: Verify AJAX verification status checking API endpoint works correctly
scenario: JavaScript makes AJAX requests to check if user's email has been verified
expected_results: API endpoint returns proper JSON response with verification status
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page
2. Use browser developer tools to monitor AJAX requests
3. Verify POST requests to /auth/check-verification-status
4. Check request includes user_id and user_email in JSON body
5. Verify response format {'verified': false/true}
6. Test with verified user (should return {'verified': true})
7. Check error handling for invalid requests
8. Verify proper JSON content-type headers

description: Verify verification tokens are properly associated with correct user accounts
scenario: Multiple users register and each receives verification for correct account
expected_results: Verification tokens are unique per user and only verify the associated account
procedure:
1. Register multiple user accounts simultaneously
2. Check each user receives unique verification token
3. Verify tokens are associated with correct user IDs in database
4. Test cross-verification (User A's token doesn't verify User B)
5. Check email verification status is specific to each user
6. Verify token security prevents unauthorized verification
7. Test concurrent verification scenarios
8. Check database integrity with multiple users

description: Verify verification pending page elements animate correctly
scenario: User observes page appearance animations on verification pending page load
expected_results: Page elements appear in staggered sequence with fade-in animations
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page (clear cache first)
2. Observe animation sequence on page load
3. Verify header animates first (animate-fade-in-up)
4. Check login attempt info box animates with 0.15s delay
5. Verify main content animates with 0.2s delay (animate-fade-in-left)
6. Check email info animates with 0.3s delay
7. Verify instructions animate with 0.4s delay
8. Check warning box, resend section, and buttons animate in sequence
9. Test animation performance and smoothness

description: Verify verification pending page displays correctly in dark mode

expected_results: All elements display properly with dark theme colors and proper contrast

1. Navigate to verification pending page

3. Verify background changes to dark theme (dark:bg-gray-900)

5. Verify text colors invert properly (dark:text-white)
6. Test info boxes styling in dark mode
7. Check button gradients work in dark theme

9. Test accessibility and contrast ratios

description: Verify verification pending page is responsive across different screen sizes
scenario: User accesses verification pending page on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices
expected_results: Page adapts properly to different screen sizes while maintaining functionality
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification pending page on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Verify max-width constraint (max-w-md) centers content
3. Resize browser to tablet size (768px width)
4. Check content scaling and spacing adjustments
5. Resize to mobile size (375px width)
6. Verify page remains usable on small screens
7. Test touch interactions on mobile
8. Check button size and touch targets meet accessibility guidelines
9. Verify action buttons stack properly on mobile (flex-col sm:flex-row)

description: Verify email verification template is secure and prevents attacks
scenario: Email template handles various inputs securely and prevents injection attacks
expected_results: Email template properly escapes user input and prevents security vulnerabilities
procedure:
1. Register user with special characters in username and email
2. Check verification email template properly escapes user input
3. Test email template with various username formats
4. Verify no HTML injection is possible in email content
5. Check verification URL is properly formatted and secure
6. Test email template with Unicode characters
7. Verify no sensitive information is exposed in email
8. Check email headers for security best practices

description: Verify verification token generation is cryptographically secure
scenario: System generates secure verification tokens that cannot be predicted or forged
expected_results: Tokens are cryptographically random, unique, and cannot be guessed
procedure:
1. Register multiple users and collect verification tokens
2. Analyze token randomness and uniqueness
3. Verify tokens cannot be predicted or sequenced
4. Check token length provides sufficient entropy
5. Test token generation under load
6. Verify tokens are not reused across users
7. Check token storage security in database
8. Test token validation is secure against timing attacks

description: Verify proper handling of database errors during verification process
scenario: Database errors occur during verification creation or validation
expected_results: Graceful error handling with proper logging and user feedback
procedure:
1. Simulate database connection failure during verification creation
2. Attempt to register new user account
3. Verify appropriate error handling
4. Check error logging for debugging
5. Test database timeout scenarios
6. Verify user receives appropriate feedback
7. Check system recovery from database errors
8. Test transaction rollback on failures

description: Verify verification pending page loads efficiently with optimal performance
scenario: User accesses verification pending page and expects fast loading times
expected_results: Page loads within acceptable time limits with all styling and functionality
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache
2. Open browser developer tools Performance tab
3. Navigate to verification pending page
4. Record page load time and performance metrics
5. Verify total load time is under 2 seconds
6. Check First Contentful Paint (FCP) is under 1 second
7. Verify Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) is acceptable
8. Test page load on slower network connections
9. Check for render-blocking resources
10. Verify animations don't impact performance significantly

description: Verify verification pending page meets accessibility standards (WCAG)

expected_results: Page is fully accessible with proper labels, ARIA attributes, and keyboard navigation

2. Test keyboard navigation through all interactive elements
3. Verify tab order is logical (resend button â†’ action buttons)

6. Verify focus indicators are visible and clear
7. Check color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
8. Test flash messages are announced by screen readers
9. Verify icons have appropriate alt text or ARIA labels
10. Check ARIA landmarks and roles are properly used

description: Verify handling of multiple verification requests for same user
scenario: User requests multiple verification emails and system handles appropriately
expected_results: System manages multiple verification requests efficiently without conflicts
procedure:
1. Register user account and receive initial verification email
2. Request resend verification multiple times
3. Verify each request generates new token
4. Check old tokens remain valid until expired
5. Test verification with newest token
6. Verify all tokens for user are invalidated after successful verification
7. Check database cleanup of old tokens
8. Test rate limiting for verification requests

description: Verify error messages display correctly with proper styling and clarity
scenario: User encounters various errors and receives clear feedback
expected_results: Error messages are displayed prominently with clear, helpful text
procedure:
1. Navigate to verification page and trigger various errors
2. Verify error messages use consistent styling (flash messages)
3. Check error messages are clearly visible
4. Test different error scenarios (invalid token, expired, CSRF failure)
5. Verify error messages don't expose sensitive information
6. Check error message accessibility for screen readers
7. Test error message dismissal functionality
8. Verify error styling in both light and dark modes

description: Verify verification system works correctly across different browsers

6. Verify animations and CSS effects work

description: Verify email verification system meets security best practices and compliance requirements
scenario: Security audit of email verification functionality and implementation
expected_results: System follows security best practices and prevents common vulnerabilities
procedure:
1. Audit verification token generation for cryptographic security
2. Verify token expiration enforcement (24 hours)
3. Check protection against token enumeration attacks
4. Test for timing attack vulnerabilities
5. Verify proper email validation and sanitization
6. Check CSRF protection implementation
7. Test for session fixation vulnerabilities
8. Verify proper error handling doesn't leak information
9. Check logging for security events
10. Verify compliance with security frameworks (OWASP)
11. Test email verification against common attack vectors
12. Verify secure communication (HTTPS enforcement)
13. Check integration security with email service
